title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Biden declared that "America is ready for a takeoff" as he pitched a sweeping vision for greater government investment to boost the economy, including a $1.8 trillion proposal for new spending on child care, education and paid leave.

---

The Biden administration intends to pursue a ban on menthol cigarettes, a move that could sweep from the market more than a third of all cigarettes sold in the U.S.

---

The Senate voted 52-42 to restore regulations on methane that leaks into the air from U.S. oil and gas production, reversing a Trump-era policy.

---

Federal investigators executed a search warrant at Giuliani's New York City apartment, an escalation of an investigation by Manhattan federal prosecutors.

---

Vaccines appear to be starting to curb new U.S. Covid-19 cases, a breakthrough that could help people return to more normal activities, public-health officials say.

Cruise operators can restart sailings out of the U.S. as early as mid-July, the CDC said, paving the way for resuming operations suspended due to the pandemic.

---

Three men were indicted on federal hate crimes charges in the killing of Ahmaud Arbery, a Black man who was fatally shot while jogging in Georgia in 2020.

---

A judge rejected motions to dismiss much of Amazon's challenge to the awarding of the Pentagon's JEDI contract to Microsoft.
